p: Capers ( Capparis spinosa L.) is a deciduous shrub native to Europe and Asia. The floral buds are harvested still closed in spring and summer and usually processed in brine. Cinnamaldehyde and benzaldehyde are the major constituents of the flavor profile of capers; of sulfur compounds, methyl-isothiocyanate is the main compound, followed by benzyl-isothiocyanate [ 77]. Rutin and kaempferol are the most abundant flavonol glucosides [ 78, 79].
